Reviews.Title: “sleep is 2nd priority”
Reviews.Author: JW52178
Reviews.Content: I consider sleep the key reason for staying in a hotel. Unfortunately loud parties in the conferrence rooms that spill outside at night are more lucrative than sleeping guests. I called twice to complain and assurances were given but to only modest results. The breakfast, pleasantness of staff, facility itself were above average but without cooperation and forsight of managment to book parties with loud music and boisterous revelers at the expense of overnight guests is a hotel not worth considering!

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be excellent”
Reviews.Author: Cannuck1964
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel about 2 years ago and it was a good stay. I needed to be in town on business and I chose it again and I was not disappointed. You won't be disappointed. Breakfast is excellent, so is the happy hour food. Rumour has it the area is not super safe if you decide to walk around and go to the restaurants, but I didn't experience any problem. I will definitely choose this hotel if I am back to Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: MS06
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Homewood Suites a number of times on business and I'm always impressed with the friendly and responsive staff. The room are comfortable and there is a good breakfast selection. There is also a really great outdoor pool. If youare coming as a tourist you really need a car as it's out of town.

Reviews.Title: “Quality is slipping”
Reviews.Author: susan n
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April and were very happy with the service and quality. That seems to have changed. We have had to ask for 2 days in a row to have the room cleaned up, clean towels, garbage emptied, toilet paper and soap and shampoo. Very disappointed. We also reserved 2 rooms each with 2 king beds. One was correct the other had 2 queen beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, outstanding personnel”
Reviews.Author: dcwusmc
Reviews.Content: I spent several days here, on some business with my wife, and it could not have been better. We were treated like royalty and I loved every minute of it. When I noticed a couple of things amiss, corrections were made, properly and QUICKLY. They are to be highly commended on all aspects of their operation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Tna28
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, on arrival we were greeted in a friendly manner and told where our room was, the rooms are detached from the main building, more like a motel, when we got to the suite it smelt musty and horrible and the toilets didn't flush, we reported both, toilets was fixed the next day and we were offered air freshener for the smell, at first glance decor looks ok, but after wandering through the corridors several times you do notice it's out dated appearance and decor faults like coving coming away, dirty walls. Our suite was furthest away from the main building so a bit of a trek through corridors to get breakfast. Breakfast was good and a lovely lady named Betty was fantastic, very friendly and helpful, really cheered my day up. Not what we expected from a Homewood Suite or the Hilton chain, very disappointing, we are travelling across USA and stayed in Hilton chain hotel and suites and this is the most disappointing by far, would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back”
Reviews.Author: geehunt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It's quiet and well off the main road. There are so many places to eat and shop in that area. I was visiting family that lived about 25 minutes away and it wasn't a bad drive from the quiet of the country to the hustle of the little area of Hacks Cross. The hotel itself is very very nice. Clean, stocked fully, Nutragena toiletries. The bed is probably one of the most comfortable I've slept in while staying at a hotel. Seriously. The room is divided with the bedroom and bathroom divided by a door you can lock and the sitting area, eating area and full kitchen (with a full fridge, dishwasher, stove and sink). When I closed the front door, it was like I was in a little apartment. Really dug the place. And the front desk reps were SUPER friendly. I would definitely go straight back to Homewood Suites when I go back. By the way, as of July 2011, their rates were far superior for what you get to the other hotels in the area. And I got the chance to use my first ever senior discount to get that amazing rate!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find at night. Needs refreshing.”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-Picky-Knickers
Reviews.Content: We had trouble finding the Homewood Suites as it is set back from the road and was hard to find at night. Friendly enough welcome. Decor definitely needs updating - many the carpets (rugs) that are showing their age. But, they may be reluctant to do this if they get a lot of groups. There was a football (soccer) competition on at that time with lots of girls and their parents staying there. So that would explain the the $109 plus tax rate - you get what you pay for. The room was clean but looked tired. Spacious as usual with a Homewoods Suite. Location was fine for driving into Memphis. Restaurants and shops close by. I was a bit disappointed with this hotel - wouldn't have wanted to pay more for the room. Breakfast service was fine and the janitor responsible for restrooms was very polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: JJSFortWorth_TX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night and if I have the chance I will do so again. Plus, we were travelling with our two small dogs and they accept them for only a $25.00 fee. It is well worth it to stay in comfort. The pet rooms are toward the back of the hotel and it really is very quiet. Front desk staff is polite, friendly and professional and it was quite noticeable since we had just stayed in a LaQuinta elsewhere in Tennesse for 4 nights with a totally opposite experience.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: NJoyNLife2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for business for years and they do the best job at making you feel like part off a family. The extended stay hotels try to foster a community spirit and this hotel does a great job at that. From the homemade breakfasts to the welcome home dinner, you always feel happy to return to your hotel after a long hard day. The dinning area is very large with high ceilings and big comfy chairs. The rooms are very clean and outside seating next to the pool is a nice touch. Although this is by no means a bad area, they have security patrolling the parking lot. They even left a note on my car saying that they cleaned my windshield this morning. The full service gas stations don't even do that anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Coco99pr
Reviews.Content: Great service, great people! You feel like home. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and exceptionally clean”
Reviews.Author: Urbs2Huds
Reviews.Content: We love to stay at the Homewood when we travel. The beds are comfier than home and the rooms contain tiny kitchens. Very nice and they generally cost about $100 a night for a king room w/ couch and kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in upscale area (Collierville)”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasSteelCityFan
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to stay in the Memphis area....granted is a little ways from downtown in Collierville but the extra distance is worth it. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Two TVs - one in the living area and one in the bedroom. A full breakfast is offered down near the lobby and it was worth going to....staff was very friendly and ingratiating. We only stayed one night so I cannot comment on the housekeeping, but we are definitely planning on coming back next time we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place while passing through”
Reviews.Author: jlpGa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on december 23 on our way to co springs. I chose this room because there are 5 of us and the price was good for a double room with separate room with pullout sofa. The hotel was a very pleasant surprise when we arrived. It was new looking and very clean. It was in a very safe area with malls and plenty of eating places nearby. While not directly on the interstate it was very easy and quick to get to and did not have to deal with road noise. The beds were very comfortable and had good covers. The breakfast was also very good. They served eggs and other hot foods which gets your day off to a good start . I have never been tocthe Memphis area before but would definitely stay here if in area again.

Reviews.Title: “SECOND VISIT”
Reviews.Author: wnytraveler09
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay here. Nicely apponted rooms; well maintained hotel. Relatively new hotel. Comfy beds. Nice linens. Nice staff. Not directly off the main highway, but worth the extra mile to drive to. Good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: skinc51
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Do not hesitate to stay here. It is a little distance from Beale Street and Graceland (about 20 - 25 minutes) but well worth it. The hotel is set back from the street and is located close to Germantown. There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby and the highway TN355 is very close. There is a free breakfast and the staff is wonderful. Miss Betty will take care of any of your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Small suites but nicely renovated”
Reviews.Author: ksheff-travel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at other Homewood Suites before so was surprised that this suite was pretty small in every way. There are granite counters and dark cherry cabinets, which are a nice upgrade. I thought it was odd that the "lodge" with the check in/out desk, lobby and breakfast area is in a separate building from the 4 floors of rooms. The front desk staff recommended the nearby China Dragon restaurant and gave us a menu, so we called to have dinner delivered. The food was fabulous and plentiful for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Memphis”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaSPAGirl
Reviews.Content: This is the first stop on our cross country trip. After driving 10 hours we arrived around 9:00 and were told that the two bedroom suite we had reserved had not been cleaned and was unavailable. The lady at the front desk was very apologitic and gave us adjoining one bedroom suites for the same rate. The suites are charming. There is real ceramic tile in the kitchen that is complete with a full size fridge, microwave, stove, sink, pots and pans and utinsils. There is a table to eat at between the kitchen and living room. The living room area is comfy with a couch and extra chair and TV. The bedrooms are tastefully decorated and come complete with a ceiling fan - which is fantastic in the South! The bathroom has granite countertops and the water pressure was great. The hot breakfast was yummy and the kitchen staff was very helpful. I would recommend this hotel for a comfortable stay in Memphis!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Billing Practices and Sales Staff”
Reviews.Author: Calcio64
Reviews.Content: Accommodations are like other Homewood Suites; however, the billing practices and sales staff are a different story. We were staying at the hotel to attend a sporting event and the hotel tried to charge us more for the room. Luckily, we had a confirmation, but the sales staff was very "tricky" trying not to honor the confirmation. After endless hours with the manager the situation was resolved. The credit card company immediately started to process the dispute having seen the confirmation from Homewood Suites at Hacks Cross. Recommend you always get a printed confirmation -- not just the number -- and call at least one day before arrival to confirm the reservation and rate. There also appears to be technology problems with the Hilton email at Hacks Cross (they do not have a means to verify if something has been "sent" through email). We had the confirmation faxed (thankfully or we would have been stuck with the extra charges). This was a terrible ordeal consuming way too much time and endless communication (written and oral) to remedy the situation. The sales staff was very unprofessional and unethical. We will not stay there again. We have stayed at the other Homewood Suites down the road and we will go back to them for future sporting travel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: cwiley34
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one night. The recpetion staff was very inviting. The room was clean and surprisingly modern with granite counter tops on the bathroom sink. The location is situated on a street that has plenty of dining (TGI Friday's, Olive Garden, etc.). The only negative was the fact that the bathroom only had a shower and no tub. Outside of that, would stay there again, trust me you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: adieax
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week. My room was spotless. The best thing about this hotel is the staff! The AGM is wonderful, everyone at the front desk was great, the social hour host was amazing. The shuttle service was wonderful, took me everywhere I wanted to go! The hotel is in a nice, safe location and the hotel is in great shape. I am going back in August!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: SkiCountry
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Homewood Suites. I was very pleasantly surprised. The guest room is very nice size with mini kitchenette, living area, work desk. Very clean hotel. The breakfast area is very nice and roomy and there is a little outdoor area where you can also eat breakfast. The staff were very attentive. I felt really spoiled with the size of my room that I am going to start researching Homewood Suites from now on. This was a very positive first time experience and I definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Extended-Stay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fedexflyer
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites Memphis-Hacks Cross became our "home away from home" when we had to move out of our Memphis house for four days due to construction. The hotel is located directly behind a Hampton Inn & Suites, and both properties are directly across the street from the world headquarters of FedEx Express. While technically in Memphis, it is on the fringe of the city, adjoining the suburb Germantown, and is in an area that has seen several retail and restaurant chains move into recently. Nearby restaurants include Outback Steakhouse, On The Border, Olive Garden, TGI Fridays, Logan's Roadhouse, McAlister's Deli, Buffalo Wild Wings and Dixie Cafe. We reserved one of the larger suites, with two king beds, along with the usual Homewood amenities: two TV's, sofa-bed, small dining table, kitchenette (stovetop, microwave, refrigerator but no oven). Breakfast each morning was very good, offering a rotating selection of hot entrees (pancakes, eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits & gravy) as well as standard cold fare (cereal, bagels, fruit). Rooms were well-maintained and service was excellent. During our stay, we did have a problem with some ants coming in our room (to get out of the cold), but maintenance quickly responded and they made it right during check-out. While you shouldn't expect luxury (it is a 3-star hotel) it is an excellent choice, particularly if you need a suite with kitchenette facilities. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The cheapest but most excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellatheactress
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great hotel. I didn't spend to much money on it either.My daughter had a soccer tournament there and she and the rest of the team and parents had a wonderful sleep The breakfast was alright my daughter said , but she is not to much of a breakfast eater . We have plan to go soon close to Thanksgiving. Sincerely, a past and future customer

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites Memphis - Hacks Cross
HotelInfo.Address: 3583 Hacks Cross Rd, Memphis, TN 38125
